headline: Woody Vasulka, Who Foresaw Video as Art, Dies at 82
abstract: He deftly manipulated electronic images to produce otherworldly, sometimes jarring visions. He also founded, with his wife, a landmark performance space.
lead_paragraph: Woody Vasulka, an experimental video artist who found inspiration in sources as diverse as Ren√© Magritte, nuclear war and technology, and who was a founder of the Kitchen, the landmark avant-garde performance space in Manhattan, died on Dec. 20 at his home in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 82.
